Justification: To rule out urinary tract infection or diabetes mellitus, which can cause polyuria and secondary enuresis.
If urinalysis suggests infection, a culture can identify the causative organism.
To rule out diabetes mellitus, especially given the history of increased fluid intake.
To assess for any structural abnormalities in the urinary tract that might contribute to enuresis.
To monitor fluid intake and voiding patterns, which can help in behavioral interventions.
To evaluate any stressors or psychological factors, such as the recent change in school, that might contribute to enuresis.
